orbotix.view.calibration
Class CalibrationView

java.lang.Object
  View
      orbotix.view.calibration.WidgetGraphicView
          orbotix.view.calibration.CalibrationView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Controller
public class CalibrationView
extends WidgetGraphicView
implements Controller

A WidgetGraphicView that helps a user visualize calibration by showing some fancy graphic output when the user does a rotation gesture.

To use, add this as a View to your XML layout, or instantiate it manually and add it to a parent View in Java. To add it to a layout resource in XML use its package name as the element name: 

         <orbotix.robot.widgets.calibration.CalibrationView
                  android:id="@+id/calibration_widget"
                  android:layout_width="fill_parent"
                  android:layout_height="fill_parent"
                  />

Inside the parent Activity for this View, you must override the Activity's android.app.Activity#dispatchTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent) method, and call this View's #interpretMotionEvent(android.view.MotionEvent) method, passing the MotionEvent to it: 

public boolean dispatchTouchEvent(MotionEvent event) {
              mCalibrationView.interpretMotionEvent(event);
              return super.dispatchTouchEvent(event);
          }

If the CalibrationView is passed a Robot using the setRobot(orbotix.robot.base.Robot) method, then the CalibrationView will calibrate the specified Robot when the user does a multi-touch gesture. If not, then it will still show the graphic, but will do nothing else. The Robot can be unset by passing null.

Runnables can be set as callbacks in setOnStartRunnable(Runnable), setOnRotationRunnable(Runnable), and setOnEndRunnable(Runnable). These will be run when calibration starts, durring calibration, or when it ends, respectively. These are great place to put sound effects. Additionally, you can extend this View and override the #onRotationStarted(android.graphics.Point, android.graphics.Point), #onRotation(double, android.graphics.Point, android.graphics.Point), and #onRotationEnded(double, android.graphics.Point, android.graphics.Point) for even more control over these events.

The CalibrationView can be disabled with disable(), and enabled again with enable(), and its visual style can be customized with setColor(Integer...), setCircleColor(Integer...), setDotColor(Integer...), setDot1Color(Integer...), setDot2Color(Integer...) and setDotSize(int)

Date: 11/22/11

setShowBothDots

public void setShowBothDots(boolean show)
Sets whether both dots will show. If this is set to false, only dot 1 will show, and dot 2 will be hidden.

Parameters:

Parameters:

setColor(Integer...)

setColor

public void setColor(java.lang.Integer... colors)
Sets the colors of this WidgetGraphic. Accepts one or two integer color values. The first color is the "inner" color, and the second is an "outer" glow color. If no second color is specified, sets that color to half the luminance of the first.

Parameters:
colors - One or two colors, as integers.

setBackgroundColors

public void setBackgroundColors(int color_off,
                                int color_on)
Sets the background colors that this will use.

Parameters:
color_off - The color that the background will be when not showing the WidgetGraphic (default color 0x00000000)
color_on - The color that the background will be when showing the WidgetGraphic (default 0x88000000)

setOnStartRunnable

public void setOnStartRunnable(java.lang.Runnable on_start)
Sets the provided Runnable as an optional Runnable to run when the WidgetGraphic starts showing. If set to null, will clear the Runnable.

Parameters:
on_start - a Runnable to run on start

setOnEndRunnable

public void setOnEndRunnable(java.lang.Runnable on_end)
Sets the provided Runnable as an optional Runnable to run when the WidgetGraphic ends showing. If set to null, will clear the Runnable.

Parameters:
on_end - a Runnable to run on end

setOnRotationRunnable

public void setOnRotationRunnable(java.lang.Runnable on_rotation)
Specifies a Runnable to run while the WidgetGraphic is rotating. Use this carefully, because this will run between each frame of animation, and could dramatically slow down the animation.

Parameters:
on_rotation - a Runnable to run on each rotation event

setRobot

public void setRobot(Robot robot)
Sets the Robot for this CalibrationDialView. If not null, the CalibrationDialView will calibrate the provided robot. If set to null, it will still display, but will not calibrate.

Specified by:
setRobot in interface Controller
Parameters:
robot - A Robot to calibrate

Parameters:

startSingleTouchCalibration

public void startSingleTouchCalibration(CalibrationView.CalibrationCircleLocation location,
                                        Point center,
                                        int radius,
                                        MotionEvent event)
Starts calibration with a single touch instead of from a rotation gesture, such as from a button press.

Parameters:
location - The position of the 'circle', relative to the location of the touch
center - The center of the touch. Usually the center of the view touched. If null, it will get it from the event.
radius - The radius of the 'circle' to be shown
event - The MotionEvent from the touch
